intro: Angelica sinanomontana, commonly known as the Himalayan angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and large, compound leaves that are deeply lobed. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in an umbel, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Angelica sinanomontana is valued for its aromatic roots and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
